translation: Which when heard could destroy the pregnancy of women.18.56.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਣਯੋ ਨਾਦ ਸ੍ਵਣੰ ਕੀਯੋ ਦੇਵਿ ਕੋਪੰ ||
transliteration: Sounyo Naad Sravanan Kooyo Dev(i) Kopan||
translation: When the goddess heard voice of the demon-chief, she was greatly enraged.

gurmukhi: ਸਜੇ ਚਰਮ ਬਰਮੰ ਧਰੇ ਸੀਸ ਟੋਪੰ ||
transliteration: Saje Charam Baramannd Ddare Soos Topan||
translation: She bedecked herself with shield and armour and wore the steel-helmet on her head.

gurmukhi: ਭੲੀ ਸਿੰਘ ਸੁਅਾਰੰ ਕੀਯੋ ਨਾਦ ੳੁੱਚੰ ||
transliteration: Bhaoo Singh Suaaran Kooyo Naad Ouchchannd||
translation: She mounted the lion and shouted loudly.

transliteration: Sure Dooh Daanvaan Ke Maan Mouchchannd||19||57||
translation: Hearing her shouts, the pride of the demons was destroyed.19.57.

gurmukhi: ਮਹਾ ਕੋਪ ਦੇਵੀ ਧਸੀ ਸੈਨ ਮੱਧੰ ||
transliteration: Mahaa Kop Devoo Dhasoo Sain Maddhan||
translation: In great ire, the goddess penetrated into the demon-army.

gurmukhi: ਕਰੇ ਬੀਰ ਬੰਕੇ ਤਹਾਂ ਅੱਧ ਅੱਧੰ ||
transliteration: Dare Boor Banke Tahaan Addh Addhan||
translation: She chopped into halves the great heroes.

gurmukhi: ਜਿਸੈ ਧਾੲਿ ਕੈ ਸੂਲ ਸੈਥੀ ਪ੍ਹਾਰਿਓ ||
transliteration: Jisai Dhaae Kai Sool Saithoo Prahaario||
translation: On whomsoever the goddess struck her blow with her trident and the destructive weapon (Saihathi);

transliteration: Tine Pher Paanan Na Baanan Sanbhdarooo||20||58||
translation: He could not hold again his bow and arrows in his hands.20.58.

gurmukhi: ਜਿਸੈ ਬਾਣ ਮਾਰਯੋ || ਤਿਸੈ ਮਾਰ ਡਾਰਯੋ ||
transliteration: Jisai Baan Mdaryo|| Tisai Maar Ddaryo||
translation: Whosover was shot with the arrow, he was killed instantly.

transliteration: Jitai Singh Dhaayo|| Titai Sain Ghaayo||21||59||
translation: Wherever the lion rushed forward, he destroyed the army.21.59.

gurmukhi: ਜਿਤੇ ਘਾੲਿ ਡਾਲੇ || ਤਿਤੇ ਘਾਰਿ ਘਾਲੇ ||
transliteration: Jite Ghaae Daale|| Tite Gdaar(i) Dhaale||
translation: All those who were killed, they were thrown into caves.

gurmukhi: ਸਮੁਹ ਸੱਤ੍ਰ ਅਾੲਿਓ || ਸੁ ਜਾਨੇ ਨ ਪਾੲਿਓ ||੨੨||੬੦||
transliteration: Samuh Sattra Aaio|| Su Jaane Na Paaio||22||60||
translation: The enemies who confronted coul not return alive.22.60.
